date: 2024-12-10
---

## Comparing GHQ 12 and BAQ 

Psychologists and researchers frequently confront the challenge of harmonising or comparing different psychological questionnaires. For example, the comparison between the General Health Questionnaire (GHQ-12) and the Brief Aggression Questionnaire (BAQ) presents unique challenges and insights. Using Harmony, an advanced tool employing natural language processing and AI, this task becomes more feasible and efficient.



{{< image src="images/gad7-becks.jpg" alt="dog" title="dog" >}}

{{< card heading="Try Harmony" copy="Compare GHQ 12 and BAQ " url="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app" >}}

{{< youtube cEZppTBj1NI >}}


Harmony's primary function is to facilitate the comparison or harmonising of different psychological tests like GHQ 12 and BAQ. The software boasts a capable database containing an array of instruments, with the option to add personalized instruments in PDF form. By using Harmony, researchers can thoroughly compare each item in the GHQ 12 and BAQ and even gain a percentage match between similar items, thus elucidating any possible correlations or contrasts. 

## Compare the items in GHQ 12 English and BAQ

The potential advantages of using Harmony to compare GHQ 12 and BAQ are numerous. Since both questionnaires tackle psychological states and behaviours, understanding their links or inconsistencies could provide vital in interpreting and collating results across different studies. Furthermore, the process of comparing GHQ 12 and BAQ becomes substantially simplified and quicker through Harmony, owing to its advanced AI technology. Researchers seeking to make the most out of their longitudinal and episodic studies, therefore, should consider using Harmony in their analytical toolbox.
